sub_topic: Liouville's theorem and fundamental theorem of algebra
message_1: Find the number of roots of the polynomial $p(z)=z^5+2z+1$ in the complex plane.
message_2: By the Fundamental Theorem of Algebra, a polynomial of degree n has exactly n roots in the complex plane, counting multiplicities. Since the given polynomial p(z) = z^5 + 2z + 1 has a degree of 5, it has exactly 5 roots in the complex plane.
